intro: Steironema verticillatum, commonly known as the spiral leaf plant, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Commelinaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive spiral arrangement of leaves around the stem, which gives it its common name. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that are clustered in racemes. It is native to tropical regions of South America and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Steironema verticillatum is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ease of cultivation.
